If your voice is quavery, it shakes slightly, usually because you are nervous, frightened, sad, etc.: "You can't let them in here," he said in a quavery voice. See
quaver
More examplesFewer examplesMargaret's voice was still quavery. "What do you want?" she asked, furious with herself for producing such a high, quavery sound.the quavery indecision of her voice Curtis confides in a quavering voice that he's been feeling sad and lonely as one of the few college students living in a violent housing project.
